meanings.definition: A temple or place of worship.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins of the fanes stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The villagers gathered at the fane to pray for a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel made the fane its home, pretending to be a tiny priest.
meanings.sent4: The fane of knowledge welcomed all seekers with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The golden light filtered through the fane, creating a serene atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The arched part of a structure, such as a bridge or doorway.
meanings.sent1: The intricate design of the fane above the entrance caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent2: The old castle's fane added a touch of elegance to the architecture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to climb up the fane and watch the world below.
meanings.sent4: The fane of the bridge resembled a graceful bow ready to shoot an arrow.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight peeked through the fane, illuminating the path ahead.

meanings.definition: A fan or devotee of a particular person or thing.
meanings.sent1: As a fane of science fiction, she collected every book in the series.
meanings.sent2: The singer's fanes waited eagerly outside the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The little girl declared herself a fane of ice cream, always asking for more.
meanings.sent4: He was a fane of classic cars, spending hours restoring vintage models.
meanings.sent5: The artist's fane praised every brushstroke, admiring the attention to detail.
